info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 21 at 8:08PM CDT until March 21 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL LIMESTONE COUNTY... At 808 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 10 miles southwest of Groesbeck, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Groesbeck around 820 PM CDT. Fort Parker State Park around 825 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Kosse and Thornton. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows.
